error.message:
Access denied when storing the parameter "/serverless-framework/deployment/s3-bucket". Please check your permissions and try again. You have the following options:
• Ensure you have permission to create SSM and S3 resources.
• Use the "provider.deploymentBucket" field to specify an existing S3 bucket.
• Manually create the S3 bucket and SSM parameter.

For more details, please refer to the documentation: https://www.serverless.com/framework/docs/guides/deployment-bucket

Original error: User: arn:aws:iam::132411682049:user/sample-clothing-images is not authorized to perform: ssm:PutParameter on resource: arn:aws:ssm:eu-north-1:132411682049:parameter/serverless-framework/deployment/s3-bucket because no identity-based policy allows the ssm:PutParameter action

C:\\wamp64\\www\\Kelly Felder Clone\\bac.serviceRawFile:
# "org" ensures this Service is used with the correct Serverless Framework Access Key.
org: jvlsk
# "service" is the name of this project. This will also be added to your AWS resource names.
service: sample-clothing-backend-aws

provider:
  name: aws
  runtime: nodejs20.x
  # Uncomment to easily set up a custom domain. Read the docs for more details:
  # https://www.serverless.com/framework/docs/providers/aws/guide/domains
  # domain: api.example.com

functions:
  api:
    handler: handler.handler
    events:
      - httpApi: "*"
    environment: PORT:3030
      ORIGIN:http://localhost:5173
      MONGODB_URI:mongodb+srv://samanseedr2:ntHXai9P3xDFIItF@jvlsk.xxz4bku.mongodb.net/kellyFelder?appName=Jvlsk
        AWS_REGION:eu-north-1
      AWS_S3_BUCKET_NAME:sample-clothing-images
